runs.comm: that's his first ball in T20Is and Gunathilaka has heaved it over midwicket, there's protection in the deep though and he did not time it perfectly
played off the back foot to mid off
stand and deliver stuff from the debutant, gets on the front foot and lofts a length ball through the line over the head of mid-on
flashes hard at a full and wide one outside off, the thick edge flying wide of the solitary slip to the third man boundary
played towards point, they think about a single but decide against it, no room to free his arms that time
Moves across his stumps and tries to lap the ball to fine leg but makes no contact

a huge appeal for caught behind! Did that carry to Ronchi? The umpires have asked for assistance from the TV umpire. So it has hit the bat. The soft signal is out from the umpire. The ball was wide down leg side and Dilshan reached a long way away from his body to try and glance it. There was a definite edge and Ronchi tumbled to his left to try and catch it. That has carried quite comfortably so Dilshan has to go.
a full ball on middle and off, pushed to mid off for a really risky single, the ball missed the stumps at the bowler's end, replays show Chandimal would have been just safe with the dive

a length ball and Gunathilaka has lofted it over mid-on, he's not timed it well so the ball hangs in the air for a long time and falls safely out of the reach of Anderson running back from the infield
flicked through midwicket for a single
full and straight, Chandimal clears his front foot and drills the ball hard and straight past the bowler, the timing is too good for mid-off as well
played behind point for a singe
short of a length outside off, cut off the back foot but to the fielder at point
steps out of his crease and drives the ball on the up to mid off, continues running down the pitch for the single
this time he has timed it superbly! Gunathilaka clears his front foot and pulls a length ball so far over deep midwicket that the ball has nearly cleared the grass banks!
backs away towards the leg side and heaves at the ball, mis-hits it such that the ball drops towards cover
full ball around off stump, driven to mid off, driven hard
the captain has fallen! Chandimal lunged on the front foot and slogged at a good length ball, the bat turned in his hand and he sliced it high to Sodhi at mid on
a full ball angling into the left-hander, flicked off the pads through square leg
played towards point off the back foot
short of a length, punched off the back foot with superb timing through cover
a quick single taken to mid on

is that another catch down the leg side? It is! Boult has got two wickets with rather poor balls. It was full and down leg side, ripe for flicking, but Jayasuriya only managed to get an edge through to Ronchi
tries to play on the leg side bit the ball goes towards point off the outside edge. That was 132 kph, for all those interested in Boult's speed
steps out of his crease, backs away towards the leg side, and pulls the short ball powerfully to the midwicket boundary
pushed towards mid off for a single
Mathews charges now, down the pitch and towards leg side to drive the ball flat over the bowler's head for four more
backs away towards leg again to try and hit through the off side, Henry follows the batsman though, Mathews defends to the bowler
banged in short, Mathews bails out of the shot and ducks

they are falling in a heap here! Mathews jumped outside leg stump to hit inside out through the off side, he had to reach away from his body to drive and ended up hitting it flat to Elliott at cover, he had to bend low to take the catch but it was a simple one
the short of a length ball lifts fro outside off stump, beating Gunathilaka's waft
stays back this time and opens the face to steer the ball to third man
hit hard off the back foot towards point where Munro makes a sharp save
short ball at the body, Gunathilaka moves across and pulls through square leg
short of a length with width outside off, Siriwardana cuts hard off the front foot and hits the small gap at point
the bouncer is too high, that's a wide

a short ball, Siriwardana hangs back in his crease, and pulls, and pulls really well ... the ball travels the distance over the cow corner boundary. They aren't trying to rein themselves in at all, are Sri Lanka
good length angling into the left-hander, pushed into the covers from the crease
dabbed with an open face behind point for a quick single
a full ball angling into the pads, tucked through midwicket
turned off the pads with the angle into him towards midwicket once again
cut off the back foot in front of point for a single
this debutant is such a good striker of the ball! He's got under a full ball outside off and Gunathilaked it far over the long off boundary, cleared his front foot and swung hard
played off the pads through midwicket
as looking to turn the ball on the leg side but it drops close on the off side off the outside edge, that was the googly, they run a quick single before Sodhi can get to the ball
played to deep square leg for a single
short and wide outside off, cut to deep point for two more
tries to drive on the off side but gets an inside edge towards short fine leg
played off the back foot through midwicket for a single
good length just outside off, played from the crease to point
a full ball outside off, he tries to drive through the off side but gets an inside edge on to the pad
swings hard as the bouncer rears up at him from over the wicket, was beaten that time but he's not shying away
a full and wide ball outside off, too wide for Gunathilaka to be able to play it, though he tried
short of a length outside off, cut off the back foot through point for two more
another wide, this time for a slow loopy bouncer that springs off the pitch and lobs over the head of the batsman, back-of-the-hand slower bouncer that was
cut off the back foot to deep point for a single
a third wide in the over, this time for the line outside off stump
a length ball outside off, hit off the back foot through covers for a single
goes back to hit through the off side but mis-times towards mid off
that falls safe at deep cover! He backed away to hit over the off side but the googly spun away from him and he ended up slicing it high in the air over the in field

that's the easiest catch you could hope to get! Gunathilaka tried to close the face of his bat and play through the leg side. The googly spun across him though and lobbed off the leading edge to Taylor at backward point. Too easy
Perera gets beaten by the googly as it angles across him, he too was trying to turn the ball on the leg side
goes back and tries to smash the ball through the off side, gets an outside edge that goes wide of short third man
played off the back foot back past the bowler, that nearly carried to Sodhi as he dived to his left
a full ball angling into the pads, clipped through square leg

a big mix up between the batsman but Ronchi misses at the batsman's end. Perera inside edged the slower ball close behind square on the leg side and the batsmen ran though Ronchi got to the ball fairly quickly
driven through the covers for a single
nudged off the pads towards short fine leg, no bat on that
the batsman moves a long way across his stumps, exposing all three stumps, and then tries to swat behind square, he missed and the umpire tells him it's not a wide because he moved a long way across
Siriwardana has to dive to get back to his crease, but Boult's under-arm misses the stumps. He was beaten by a slower ball that hit his pad and rolled down the pitch
slugs a length ball down the ground, towards long offa
a full toss outside off, hit off the back foot through cover
another full toss outside off stump, driven off the back foot through point
a full and wide ball outside off, played back to Munro
a full toss outside off stump, the third in the over, this one isn't punished either, Perera slaps it hard but to the fielder at cover
full outside off again, driven along the ground to the man at cover
tries to hit the ball through square leg but misses, he ball goes to short fine leg off the pad
backs away towards leg and swats a short of a length ball to cover
the yorker, but it is also a no-ball, dug out on the leg side for a quick single, free-hit coming up. That hit Siriwardana's boot and he is hobbling a bit. Needs a quick visit from the physio.
he was aiming for the yorker but it ends up as a full toss on the pads, Perera swings hard and hits it to the long leg boundary, he hit it flat and far enough to just clear the boundary
pulled smack out of the middle of the bat but hit straight to the fielder at deep midwicket
moves across his stumps to a full toss that tails into leg stump from outside off - reverse swing? - and clips it behind square
puled through midwicket for a single
backs away and plays the slower ball through midwicket
a loose full toss outside off again, Perera reaches for it and carves the ball over the infield at cover
another full toss, is Munro bowling that intentionally?! Perera clears his front foot and blasts it straight, long on can't prevent the boundary to his right
short ball this time, pulled hard to deep square leg
fuller length outside off, driven through covers for a single
a length ball outside off, Perera stays back in his back foot and slashes hard at the ball, edging it between short third man and backward point for another boundary
that's deep in the grass banks! A length ball from Henry, Siriwardanad clears his front foot and loft cleanly over the long off boudnary
driven through point for a single
another no-ball, it was in the blockhole again and Perera played it back to the bowler. He has another free-hit to attack ...
the free-hit is a full toss again, on the pads, Perera swings hard across the line, taking one hand off the bat too, and finds the square leg boundary
he's holed out off the full toss! Perera swung hard across the line, dragging the full toss from outside off stump to Guptill at long on, a simple catch and Sri Lanka's chase suffers another blow
shot! A low full toss outside off, Siriwardana leans forward and opens the face as he drives, placing the ball behind point and in front of short third man
pushed into the covers for a single
a dipping full toss, Siriwardana leans forward and drives the ball in the air just past Sodhi's outstretched left hand to long on
leans forward and drives away from his body, he was aiming for cover but the outside edge took the ball between backward point and short third man
this time he does hit the ball where he wanted to hit it - a drive to cover - and gets no run
played towards extra cover, another dot ball
dragged short on leg stump, Kapugedera pulls to the deep backward square leg boundary, McClenaghan hurtles along the boundary and dives at full tilt but can't pull it back
pushed through cover point for a single
slower ball from the back of the hand, just short of a length, Kapugedera pulls to square leg
fuller on the pads, flicked behind square and they run the second before fine leg can prevent it
tries to flick the ball behind square but misses and is hit on the pad
another slower ball, Siriwardana pulls too early and is hit on the pad, that was missing leg stump
and there's one of the ones, driven into the covers off the front foot and they take on the throw from the fielder on the edge of the circle

that is some catch from McClenaghan! Boult pitched the leg-breakish slower ball short of a length and Siriwardana pulled in the air towards deep midwicket. McClenaghan ran a long way from deep square leg and was going at a brisk speed when he slid to take the catch, superbly judged. Huge wicket.
taps his first ball towards short third man for a single
clears his front foot and lofts the ball back over the bowler's head, not timed well enough to beat Guptill at long on
Kapugedera tries to play a reverse swat and mis-times it, it falls near his feet
is Munro going to catch that? No, it falls just over his head! Kulasekara got down on one knee and slogged the ball hard towards deep midwicket
gets down on one knee again and slogs the ball towards wide long on, they race back for the second
short ball to finish his spell, pulled to deep midwicket
a low full toss, driven through cover for just the single
a length ball outside leg stump, pulled to long leg, that was a loose ball but just the single
the bouncer, Kulasekara backs away and pulls but is beaten, a dot ball is gold for New Zealand
nearly in the blockhole, dug out to long on, the batsmen run back for the second and McClenaghan is not happy and makes that quite clear
played to long on again for a single this time
a swinging full toss, beats the outside edge of the heave to the leg side and hits the pad for a leg bye on the off side
Kapugedera tries to smash the ball over the off side but carves it in the air over point, it falls safe and they come back for two! Kapugedera keeps strike
half an appeal for lbw as Kapugedera plants his foot forward and outside off to slog to the leg, he misses and is hit on the pad, they run a leg bye on the off side

Boult's taken the catch at deep midwicket. That slower ball was 88kph and Kulasekara slogged across the line, he was beaten by the change of pace and giving Boult an easy catch under the circumstances

the blockhole delivery dug out to long on, Kapugedera has got to come back for the second, he has to try and keep the strike. But Guptill gets to the ball quickly from the boundary, he picks up cleanly and unleashes a flat and fast throw on the bounce to Ronchi who breaks the stumps with Kapugedera well short
the slower ball outside off stump, mis-timed off the back foot to cover and that should be the game
Elliott does not overstep, so New Zealand will win by three runs, despite Vandersay's deft move across the stumps to paddle the ball to the fine leg boundary
